channel.title: Comments on: MySQL Cluster Auto-Installer – labs release
channel.description: Database technologies - especially around scalability and High Availability

item.title: By: arri
item.dc:creator: arri
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../auto-installer-labs-release/index.html#comment-477969">Regan</a>.
I'm facing the same problem on Windows Server 2012 R2. I'm using CygWin ssh server.
Frustrating part is that i've had it working fine before in a cluster of 4 VM's (all running W2K12R2).
Any insight would be great!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Regan.

I’m facing the same problem on Windows Server 2012 R2.
I’m using CygWin ssh server.

Frustrating part is that i’ve had it working fine before in a cluster of 4 VM’s (all running W2K12R2).

Any insight would be great!

item.title: By: andrew
item.dc:creator: andrew
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../auto-installer-labs-release/index.html#comment-565978">Nezar</a>.
Thanks for your question. I'm no longer directly involved with MySQL (I'm now with MongoDB) and so I'd suggest that you seek help from <a href="http://forums.mysql.com/" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">http://forums.mysql.com/</a>.
Best Regards, Andrew.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Nezar.

Thanks for your question. I’m no longer directly involved with MySQL (I’m now with MongoDB) and so I’d suggest that you seek help from http://forums.mysql.com/.

Best Regards, Andrew.

item.title: By: Nezar
item.dc:creator: Nezar
item.description:
Hello, I am trying to create my cluster on two hosts: 192.168.1.5 (management node, sql node, data node) and 192.168.1.6 (sql node and data node). The cluster deploys sucessfully, but when I use deploy and start cluster I get this error: SyntaxError: unexpected number the error appears just after starting the N49 service. any suggestion?
Many thanks
item.content:encoded:
Hello,
I am trying to create my cluster on two hosts: 192.168.1.5 (management node, sql node, data node) and 192.168.1.6 (sql node and data node). The cluster deploys sucessfully, but when I use deploy and start cluster I get this error: SyntaxError: unexpected number
the error appears just after starting the N49 service.
any suggestion?

Many thanks

item.title: By: Sara Borghol
item.dc:creator: Sara Borghol
item.description:
Hello,
When creating MySQL cluster using Auto-installer on Hyper-v , and trying to add the local machine as a host, it fail to get the resource information of the machine giving me [error : Number_of_Processors] , also, doesn't give the right MySQL install directory , and MySQL data directory. Is this related to creating cluster using hyper-V and not on physical machine?
item.content:encoded:
Hello,

When creating MySQL cluster using Auto-installer on Hyper-v , and trying to add the local machine as a host, it fail to get the resource information of the machine giving me [error : Number_of_Processors] , also, doesn’t give the right MySQL install directory , and MySQL data directory. Is this related to creating cluster using hyper-V and not on physical machine?

item.title: By: andrew
item.dc:creator: andrew
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../auto-installer-labs-release/index.html#comment-477969">Regan</a>.
Sorry - this isn't an error that I've come accross - hopefully someone else can comment?
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Regan.

Sorry – this isn’t an error that I’ve come accross – hopefully someone else can comment?

item.title: By: Regan
item.dc:creator: Regan
item.description:
Hi Andrew,
I'm trying to install mysql cluster 7.4.6-winx64. i stuck on error sounds like this "Error: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found." on remote host. I try to ignore the error and proceed to the final step and the error still the same Unable to create directory on host [remote host ip address]: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found." At first I think this is a SSH Server problem on remote host. But i've tried 3 SSH Server, FreeSSHd, OpenSSH, BitviseSSH, and the errors still same.
I try to do some research related to the error, and find that there is possibility that python unable to compile the DLL. I've stuck for several days by now.
maybe any suggestion that I could try?
Thanks and Best Regards Regan
item.content:encoded:
Hi Andrew,

I’m trying to install mysql cluster 7.4.6-winx64.
i stuck on error sounds like this “Error: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found.” on remote host. I try to ignore the error and proceed to the final step and the error still the same Unable to create directory on host [remote host ip address]: DLL load failed: The specified module could not be found.”
At first I think this is a SSH Server problem on remote host.
But i’ve tried 3 SSH Server, FreeSSHd, OpenSSH, BitviseSSH, and the errors still same.

I try to do some research related to the error, and find that there is possibility that python unable to compile the DLL. I’ve stuck for several days by now.

maybe any suggestion that I could try?

Thanks and Best Regards
Regan

item.title: By: andrew
item.dc:creator: andrew
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../auto-installer-labs-release/index.html#comment-460906">steven</a>.
Correct - MCM is part of the commercial version of MySQL Cluster - MySQL Cluster Carrier Grade Edition. Like other pieces of Oracle software, you can download it from edelivery.oracle.com and try it out for 30 days before deciding whether the added value justifies the purchase.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to steven.

Correct – MCM is part of the commercial version of MySQL Cluster – MySQL Cluster Carrier Grade Edition. Like other pieces of Oracle software, you can download it from edelivery.oracle.com and try it out for 30 days before deciding whether the added value justifies the purchase.

item.title: By: andrew
item.dc:creator: andrew
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../auto-installer-labs-release/index.html#comment-460951">steven</a>.
After the auto-installer has shown you the default paths for each host - make sure that the path for the binaries matches where you've actually stored them on the target machines.
Andrew.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to steven.

After the auto-installer has shown you the default paths for each host – make sure that the path for the binaries matches where you’ve actually stored them on the target machines.

Andrew.

item.title: By: steven
item.dc:creator: steven
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../auto-installer-labs-release/index.html#comment-460942">steven</a>.
I change the local host setting to its IP, got a bit further but now I get this,
======== Cannot locate ndbmtd in /usr/sbin/['bin', 'sbin', 'scripts', '', '../scripts'] on host 10.100.32.71 ========
?
item.content:encoded:
In reply to steven.

I change the local host setting to its IP, got a bit further but now I get this,

========
Cannot locate ndbmtd in /usr/sbin/[‘bin’, ‘sbin’, ‘scripts’, ”, ‘../scripts’] on host 10.100.32.71
========

?

item.title: By: steven
item.dc:creator: steven
item.description:
In reply to <a href="./../auto-installer-labs-release/index.html#comment-460938">steven</a>.
nope,
========== Command `/usr/sbin/ndb_mgmd --initial --ndb-nodeid=49 --config-dir=/var/lib/mysql/MySQL_Cluster/49/ --config-file=/var/lib/mysql/MySQL_Cluster/49/config.ini', running on 10.100.32.62 exited with 1: MySQL Cluster Management Server mysql-5.6.23 ndb-7.4.4 2015-03-18 15:42:33 [MgmtSrvr] ERROR -- at line 68: Mixing of localhost (default for [NDBD]HostName) with other hostname(10.100.32.62) is illegal 2015-03-18 15:42:33 [MgmtSrvr] ERROR -- at line 68: Could not store previous default section of configuration file. 2015-03-18 15:42:33 [MgmtSrvr] ERROR -- Could not load configuration from '/var/lib/mysql/MySQL_Cluster/49/config.ini' ==========
item.content:encoded:
In reply to steven.

nope,

==========
Command `/usr/sbin/ndb_mgmd –initial –ndb-nodeid=49 –config-dir=/var/lib/mysql/MySQL_Cluster/49/ –config-file=/var/lib/mysql/MySQL_Cluster/49/config.ini’, running on 10.100.32.62 exited with 1:
MySQL Cluster Management Server mysql-5.6.23 ndb-7.4.4
2015-03-18 15:42:33 [MgmtSrvr] ERROR — at line 68: Mixing of localhost (default for [NDBD]HostName) with other hostname(10.100.32.62) is illegal
2015-03-18 15:42:33 [MgmtSrvr] ERROR — at line 68: Could not store previous default section of configuration file.
2015-03-18 15:42:33 [MgmtSrvr] ERROR — Could not load configuration from ‘/var/lib/mysql/MySQL_Cluster/49/config.ini’
==========
